What is the LEFT formula in Excel?

The LEFT function lets you extract characters from a text in a specific cell.

The LEFT formula in Excel is =LEFT(text,[num_chars])



The function syntax has 2 arguments : text and [num_chars]; the last argument is optional.

 * text â€“ the cell containing the characters you want to extract.

 * num_chars â€“ how many characters you want to extract, starting from the left.

â€“ If you donâ€™t enter any value for [num_chars], the system assumes it means 0 if you entered =LEFT(text,). The cell containing the result will be empty.

â€“ If you donâ€™t enter any value for [num_chars], the system assumes it means 1 if you entered =LEFT(text).

Whatâ€™s the formula for the LEFT formula in Google Sheets?

With this in mind, t he LEFT formula in Google Sheets is =LEFT(string, [number_of_characters])

What is the RIGHT function in Excel?

The RIGHT function lets you extract characters from a text in a specific cell, starting from the right of the text string.

The RIGHT formula in Excel is =RIGHT(text,[num_chars])



The function syntax has 2 arguments : text and [num_chars]; the last argument is optional.

 * text â€“ the cell containing the characters you want to extract.

 * num_chars â€“ how many characters you want to extract, starting from the right.

If you want to use the RIGHT function in Google Sheets, you can use a similar syntax. The RIGHT formula in Google Sheets is =RIGHT(string, [number_of_characters])

What is the MID function in Excel?

The MID function lets you extract characters from a text, starting from a specific position.

The MID formula is =MID(text,start_num,num_chars)



The function syntax has 3 arguments : text, start_num and num_chars; the last argument is optional.

* text â€“ the cell containing the characters you want to extract.

* start_num â€“ the starting position for the search to start from.

* num_chars â€“ how many characters you want to extract, starting from the start_num position and from the left.

â€“ If you donâ€™t enter any value for num_chars, the system assumes it means 0 if you entered =MID(text,start_num,). The cell containing the result will be empty.

â€“ We recommend entering all the values in the MID formula.

â€“ If the num_chars argument is higher than the characters number of the text after the starting point, the system will include all the characters found from start_num.

If you want to use the MID function in Google Sheets, you can use a similar syntax than the one in Excel. The MID formula in Google Sheets is =MID(string, starting_at, extract_length)
